message:
"Everyone can tell you the risk. An Entrepreneur can see the reward."
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur is back with Entrepreneurship Awareness Drive to help you unearth the hidden entrepreneur in you.
With an objective to promote entrepreneurship in campuses across India, Entrepreneurship Awareness Drive 2018 will cover 22 cities in 22 days. Witness prominent entrepreneurs from across the country share their vast experience and knowledge through a series of guest lectures, panel discussions and workshops!
Register now at: ead.ecell-iitkgp.org/comingsoon
#EAD2018
#Coming_soon

Learning and networking are the two crucial practices in a startup building process, so to aid entrepreneurs in these important steps, E-cell IIT Kharagpur is glad to announce Local Startups Meet, a one of its kind initiative aimed to provide a comprehensive learning and networking experience to the early stage startups in Tier 1 cities.
The event is open to all startups(product ready) that are on the lookout of funding and mentoring, as well as for startups that are currently in the Alpha stage of product development!
Register your startup at:-ead.ecell-iitkgp.org/comingsoon
#LSM
#EAD

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
Redbull in association with Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur launched its Redbull Basement University challenge through which KGP students will get a chance to show their best and brightest ideas to solve social and environmental problems inside the campus, thereby getting an opportunity to turn their idea into reality through redbull's network of funds, mentoring and incubation!
To register your idea in the challenge, log on to www.redbull.com/in-en/projects/red-bull-basement-university
#Redbull
#BasementUniversity

Lean startup, simply put, is a concept of validated learnings and build-measure-learn-feedback loop. With the advent of this concept, startups now have tools that speed up the search for customers, ensure that what is  being built meets customer needs, facilitates reduced time to market and slashes the cost of development.
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur has come up with a first of its kind PAN India initiative, targeted towards the alpha stage startups to familiarise them with the concept of going lean to understand the rapidly evolving market needs. Stay tuned for more updates!
#LSM
#Coming_Soon

Ever wondered, how much profit does Flipkart make in a year?
Want to know? Watch this video in which we ask the very same question to our freshers, who came up with some compelling answers!
Though, it was not surprising to note that most of them couldn't even get close to the correct answer because of the common myths that people have about entrepreneurship.
In our #Breaking_the_myth campaign we tried to make the freshers aware about these myths in a very engaging and entertaining manner.
#Freshers_Intro_seminar
#Breaking_the_myth

Happy Birthday to arguably one of the most loved co-founders, Steve Wozniak, when it comes to the tech products!
“I hope you're as lucky as I am. The world needs inventors--great ones. You can be one. If you love what you do and are willing to do what it really takes, it's within your reach. And it'll be worth every minute you spend alone at night, thinking and thinking about what it is you want to design or build. It'll be worth it, I promise.”

Software giant Microsoft has launched Teams, and social networking behemoth Facebook has Workplace. Slack recently crossed 8 Million subscribers, with more than 3 Million of paid subscriptions. Now, the company is planning to capitalise on that with some more funding.

#Creating_Impact

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos.
message:
It is quite often said that need is the mother of invention and the most ground-breaking inventions inventions are a result of persistent efforts. Although some breakthroughs take a lifetime of dedication, there are some examples which are enough to prove that even a twist of fate and an observant mind can create something worthy of transforming the world. Here are some of the the discoveries that were unintentional yet compelling.
Empresario, the global business model competition of E-cell IIT Kharagpur has always ensured that revolutionary ideas go forward even if they were mere coincidences. The 2018-19 edition of Empresario will be launched soon, stay tuned for further updates!

The shift of industries towards efficiency, comfort and affordability has led to creation of tremendous amounts of non-biodegradable waste which is now having a pernicious impact on our world. Take a look at how these IIT Kharagpur gradutes are taking strides towards solving this nagging complication. With a focus on the 3R concept of Reduce, Reuse and Recycle, they founded Anthill Creations with a mission to provide sustainable, long lasting and impactful solutions for childrens playgrounds by using eliminated wheel tyres and other non biodegradable waste!
#IITKGP #CreatingImpact

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos.
message:
Entrepreneurship Cell IIT Kharagpur has been offering a helping hand to all the budding student entrepreneurs across the country through its various meticulously thought initiatives. We believe in getting more superior and efficient every year, and we’re proud to put forth the major initiatives of 2018-19. Entrepreneurship Awareness Drive, a PAN India drive promoting entrepreneurship. Empressario, Asia's 1st B-model competition. The annual corporate summit, Global Entrepreneurship Summit. Kharagpur Angel Network, exclusive funding platform for IIT Kharagpur startup community and Innovation Conclave, an initiative to explore the commercial aspect of research projects. 
We look forward to have a great participation in all our upcoming initiatives!

It was in late 2007 that two IIT Delhi graduates with a couple of years’ work experience at Amazon India decided to start their own venture. Sachin and Binny Bansal started with selling books online on their brainchild ‘Flipkart’ and Flipkart has been the Poster Boy of the Indian Startup Ecosystem ever since. 
For a generation of entrepreneurs, Flipkart has been the inspiration to start up. The e-commerce giant has secured a funding of more than $7 Bn since its inception, and the recent happenings have taken its valuation to around $20 Bn. With the Walmart-Flipkart acquisition becoming a done deal, the Indian Startup Ecosystem is all set to face a revolution.

Various Pundits in the financial industry have made it clear that cryptocurrencies  are in a massive bubble which will end badly for many smaller less sophisticated investors. 2018 has already been a disappointing year for the investors, with the value of bitcoin plummeting by more than 30 percent!

Agri-tech startups have been on the rise since 2016, with more than $360 Mn being infused in the sector during the Financial year 2016-17. Founded by IIT Kharagpur alumni Taranjeet Singh and Deepak Jaiswal along with Prof. Mrigank Sharad, AgNext recently raised an undisclosed amount of investment from impact investor- Omnivore Partners. The startup was incubated at Science and Technology Entrepreneurs Park at IIT Kharagpur, and received seed funding and acceleration from a-IDEA, which is managed by the National Academy of Agricultural Research Management in Hyderabad. 
#IITKGP_startups
#AgriTech

Alumni of Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur have made significant contributions in the Indian Startup Ecosystem over the years. Numerous successful startups have been co-founded by E-Cell IIT KGP Alumni, which include Runnr, Capillary Technologies and magicpin. Witworks, a smart wearables startup co-founded by Ankit D.P. with a couple of batch-mates - Somnath Meher Chandrashekhar Iyer, has been acquired by Fashion ecommerce giant Myntra, in an attempt to establish its presence in the wearable tech industry. 
#Ecell_IITKGP
#CreatingImpact

Yet another Empresario-backed startup in the news! After winning the Products and Services Track of Empresario 2017-18, Gnomikx is the only Indian startup to qualify for the Finals of the International Business Model Competition, that is being hosted by BYU (Brigham Young University). The startup will compete with 40 other international teams for a prize money of $150,000. Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team of Gnomikx, and wishes them all the best for the Final round of the competition!

Launched in 2012 with an aim to empower data backed decision making in the fields of public infrastructure, public health & education spaces, SocialCops has come a long way since then. After winning the prestigious B-model competition of IIT Kharagpur- Empresario, it went on to receive a seed funding of $350K from investors that include Rajan Anandan (MD, Google India) and Manoj Menon (MD, Frost & Sullivan APAC), and was recently selected for the Launchpad Accelerator programme of Google.

Regarded as Hindi cinema’s first female superstar, Sridevi gave us superhit movies from Himmatwala to Mr. India and was the honoured recipient of Padma Shri. Being pure from the heart, she even took initiatives for a better society through TV shows like Satyamev Jayate and working with the government for social causes. It is indeed a jewel that all of us have lost, let us hope that her endeavors go on to inspire the upcoming generations!

In 1999, after working for more than 8 technology companies, he decided to start his own venture, and ultimately went on to become the maker of more than 10 startups since then. After retirement, he wrote a book which launched the lean startup movement. In 2013, Forbes listed him under the 30 most influential people in tech., with a net worth of $2.5 Billion! Popularly called as one of the Godfathers of the silicon valley, Steve Blank is a personality worth admiring! 
Catch him live during The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 on 4th February, 9:30 AM.

Join us in a Panel Discussion on 'If I knew then what I know now' during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February!

Cryptocurrencies have been the talk of the town for quite some time now, with Facebook recently banning cryptocurrency ads since some exchanges were not acting in "Good Faith". Selecting a proper cryptocurrency exchange is a tedious job, since the whole process is completely decentralised and involves no guarantee from the government. 
Join us in a Certified Workshop on "Cryptocurrencies & Blockchains" by Zebpay and make Baby steps towards cryptocurrency trading, during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February!
#GES2k18

Imagine a four year old kid tiptoeing his way to the top of a car window with mojhris in his hand at a traffic signal. Who would have thought that the same kid would introduce E-commerce in India in 1997, years before the industry flourished. Later, in 2004, he founded Palador Pictures- which went on to become one of the largest libraries of World Cinemas. Selling Mojhris was probably his first entrepreneurial venture!
Be a part of Mr. Gautam Shiknis' talk on "Accessing Capital to Global Markets" during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February!
#GES2k18

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added an event.
message:
Cryptocurrencies, popularly called as Money 2.0, are all set to bring in a revolution in the Financial Market. But veterans like Warren Buffett have cautioned us to stay away from this Blockchain based currency.
Lately, there has been a huge infusion of money into Bitcoins and altcoins, but the volatility in the cryptocurrency market has resulted into numerous administrations banning the use of cryptocurrencies.  Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur invites you a session where experts from India and abroad will clear all the myths about cryptocurrencies, trading patterns, and the future of the highly speculated form of currency!
Date: 02:30PM
Time: 03-02-2018
Veunu: Kalidas Auditorium

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur conducted the Demo Day of Kharagpur Angel Network at Matrix Partners India Office in Bangalore recently. The event gave five shortlisted startups of alumni and students of KGP to pitch in front of institutional investors from Matrix Partners, Ankur Capital, Lead Angels, Ventureast and Vida Ventures and many angel investors as well.

The Panel Discussion witnessed Amod Malviya, Co-founder of UDAAN and Rajesh Yabaji, Cofounder and CEO of Blackbuck sharing their inspirational story about why and how they started up. The two stalwart KGP entrepreneurs with their deep experience and passion motivated the budding entrepreneurs.

The event culminated with the Networking Session where KGP entrepreneurs, Angels and VCs discussed the KGP start up scenario and the general market trends. Overall, it was a very enriching session for the emerging KGP entrepreneurs.

Presenting to you, the next speaker in the lineup, Mr. Rajesh Balpande, Co-founder and Director at BookMyShow.
Catch him live during The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February!

Technology giant Google has a mission to empower more and more people with internet access, thereby getting more people to sell to. In 2013, Google India started converting the 163-year old Indian Railways into a fibre optic network to bring internet to all. Today, the service has expanded to more than 150 stations across the country, with more than 7 Million monthly active users!
The man heading this project is Gulzar Azad, who has converted the idea of setting up a 45,000 kilometres wireless infrastructure, into a reality!
Catch him live during The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February.
#GES2k18

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur with Catapooolt.
message:
Catapooolt Product Czars in association with Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur presents the Kharagpur Chapter of India's Largest Product Hunt launched with the objective of helping product based startups through mentoring, funding and media visibility!
Showcase your innovation during GES'18 and get a chance to connect with investors and raise fund via crowdfunding.

If you are a Product based startup who is looking for funding opportunities, Register at: productczars.catapooolt.com
Only GES Participants can pitch their products in the event. Register for GES at: ges.ecell-iitkgp.org/register

After foraying into the cement business by compulsion rather than choice, he proved his mettle by converting Ambuja Cements into a profitable entity. Real Estate was his first love, and he somehow made his way into the construction business in 1982. Today, he is the Chairman of the INR 2500 Crore Ambuja Neotia Group, which is one of the leading real estate companies in the country.
Presenting to you, the First Keynote Speaker of GES 2018- Mr. Harshavardhan Neotia.
To catch him live during GES 2018, Register at: ges.ecell-iitkgp.org/register

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
In the last 5 years, Startup activity in India has gained immense velocity. While you might be willing to toil and put everything on the line to launch your dream venture, numbers aren't quite good on your side, 90% of the startups fail. 
At the beginning, you need to accelerate your startup's growth substantially. 

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur presents a series of Startup Growth hacking workshops where eminent personalities from different industries will talk about different aspects of scaling up a new venture.
Catch them live during GES'18 from 2nd-4th February!
Register at: www.ges.ecell-iitkgp.org
#GES2k18

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with Matrix Partners calls out to all the entrepreneurs, innovators and investors from the KGP community to come together and celebrate this vibrant ecosystem of our startups through KAN. We look forward to seeing you all at the Matrix Partners Bangalore office Rooftop on 24th January. As always, KGP ka tempo high hai!

As part of the event, we are delighted to announce that we will have Amod Malviya (Co-founder, Udaan) and Rajesh Yabaji (Cofounder and CEO, Blackbuck) join in a panel discussion on "All things Kgp and Startup" moderated by Raghav Nagarajan, Investment Professional from Matrix. 

If you are interested in being a part of the Panel Discussion and Networking session please RSVP here: https://tinyurl.com/ecell-kan2018

If you are an Investor who wants to discover the IIT Kharagpur startup ecosystem, apply here: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/kan/investform.php

PS: The networking event is invite only as seats are limited, please fill in the form early!

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
Presenting to you, the first element of GES 2018!

Cryptocurrencies, popularly called as Money 2.0, are all set to bring in a revolution in the Financial Market. But veterans like Warren Buffett have cautioned us to stay away from this Blockchain based currency.

In order to clear this never ending dilemma of whether to invest or not, Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur invites you to three interactive sessions that includes experts from India and abroad.
Register now: www.ges.ecell-iitkgp.org

The Indian startup eco-system has seen tremendous growth and value creation in the last decade. IIT Kharagpur, with over 200 startups from campus, has been on the forefront of this startup revolution. 

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur hence calls out to all the entrepreneurs, innovators and investors from the KGP community to come together and celebrate this vibrant ecosystem of our startups through KAN. We look forward to seeing you all at the Matrix Partners Bangalore office Rooftop on 24th January. As always, KGP ka tempo high hai!

If you are a startup which has at least one KGP co-founder and are looking to raise funding, apply here: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/kan/startupform.php (Deadline Monday 15th Jan 2018)

If you are an Investor who wants to discover the IIT Kharagpur startup ecosystem, apply here: http://ecell-iitkgp.org/kan/investform.php

If you are interested in being a part of the Networking session and further meet a lot of KGP people, apply here: https://tinyurl.com/ecell-kan2018

PS: The networking event is invite only as seats are limited, please fill in the form early!

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos — with Zone Startups/India.
message:
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur recently organised the first ever edition of its Lean Startup Drive in the startup city of India- Bengaluru, in association with Skillenza and Zone Startups/India Adopting lean startup methodologies for an early stage startup is vital, the mantras of developing a Minimum Viable Product(MVP) were given by eminent entrepreneurs like Rohith Veerajappa and Manik Choudhary. A number of startups including Swatronix, NayaGaadi and Zingo Hotels were also present, in what turned out to be a really amazing local startups meet. 
#LSD2k18
#Bengaluru

The lifecycle of any start-up can be broadly divided into 3 stages:-

Stage 1: Problem-Solution Fit 
The objective of this stage is to find a problem worth solving 

Stage 2: Product-Market Fit 
The objective of this stage is to build something people want and validate your business model 

Stage 3: Scale After Product/Market 
Here, your main objective is to SCALE. 

We often see start-ups in the pursuit of Product-Market Fit without actually achieving Problem-Solution Fit. Adopting Lean startup methodologies is very essential for any early stage startup.
To develop MVP(Minimum Viable Product), Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur, & Zone Start-ups present Lean Start-up Drive. 
Learn the mantras of excelling with the best possible output for you. Interact, ask and learn!
Venue: The Thought Factory, Bengaluru
Date & Time: 23rd December 2017 | 10 A.M
Register at: ecell-iitkgp.org/lsd

story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
A workshop on Product Engineering and IP Commercialisation was conducted by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur in association with RMoSEE. We saw participation from Prodex, Technology Transfer Group, RGSOIPL and RMoSEE. The speaker, Mr. Kameshwar Eranki, Founder and CEO, VajraSoft Inc.,USA, threw light on the impact  of disruptive technologies on future markets and the ease of management of one's Intellectual Property through technological advancements. 
Additionally, a hands-on demo was shown to the participants in areas of Reverse Engineering, 3D Printing and Rapid Prototyping.
